page.title: 09FREE-RANGE CHICKENS,ST.ALLEN
page.content: The modern awareness of health-foods leads to great demand for "free-range" eggs.The 450 Rhode-Island Red hybrid chickens at Nancarrow live in 3 modern sheds & run out in fields with cattle or sheep during the day.There is a problem with foxes which are shot when possible.Chickens are fed afternoon & evening with wheat & barley grown and milled on the farm,mixed with bought maize,fish-meal/soya concentrate,& whole oats & barley-grains.The brown eggs are collected twice daily,sold to health-food shops & a restaurant in Truro,to Shortlanesend village shop,& direct from farm to passing trade & regulars.Prices are 40p/doz.pullet's eggs to 84p/doz.size 1(large). Production of over 150 dozen a week cannot keep pace with demand.
